info.title: Gasoline MCP Server
info.description: Browser observability for AI agents. Streams console logs, network errors, and user actions from Chrome to Claude Code, Cursor, and Copilot via MCP protocol.

x-planes.control: Server lifecycle, health, and protocol endpoints
x-planes.data-read: Server → MCP client telemetry reads (GET only)
x-planes.media: Screenshot, video recording, and annotation capture
x-planes.ci: CI/CD infrastructure: snapshots, buffer clear, test boundaries
x-planes.automation: File and form automation (Stage 4 OS automation gated by --enable-os-upload-automation)

tags.name: Control
tags.description: Server health, discovery, lifecycle, and protocol

tags.name: Media
tags.description: Screenshot, video recording, and annotation capture

tags.name: CI
tags.description: CI infrastructure: snapshots, clear, test boundaries

get.description: Returns server name, version, and links to key endpoints.
Returns server status, version, log stats, and capture state.
Comprehensive diagnostic information for bug reports: system info, buffer counts, extension state, circuit breaker status.

post.description: Initiates graceful server shutdown. Sends SIGTERM after response.

get.description: Returns this OpenAPI 3.1.0 specification as JSON.

post.description: MCP protocol bridge for HTTP clients. Accepts JSON-RPC 2.0 requests with methods: observe, generate, configure, interact.
Ingest console log entries from the browser extension.
Record network waterfall entries from the browser extension.
Record network request/response bodies from the browser extension.
Record WebSocket events from the browser extension.

get.description: Unified read endpoint for all telemetry buffers. Replaces individual GET endpoints on /logs, /network-waterfall, /network-bodies, /websocket-events, /enhanced-actions, /performance-snapshots.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum entries to return (returns most recent N)

get.description: Returns active and recently-closed WebSocket connections with message rates and sampling info.

post.description: Record user actions from the browser extension.
Record Web Vitals snapshots from the browser extension.
Unified endpoint for extension to submit results of any query or async command. Replaces separate dom-result, a11y-result, state-result, execute-result, highlight-result endpoints.
Save a screenshot JPEG from the browser extension. Rate limited to 1/second per client.

query_id.description: Pending query ID for on-demand flow

post.description: Save a tab video recording from the offscreen document. Accepts multipart form with video blob and metadata JSON.
Register a new MCP client with a working directory.

get.description: Get a specific MCP client registration.

post.description: Unified bidirectional sync endpoint. Replaces separate polling for pending-queries, settings, extension-logs, and extension-status. The extension sends its state and receives commands in a single round-trip.

get.description: Aggregated snapshot of all capture buffers for CI/testing. Supports filtering by timestamp and test ID.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Only include entries after this RFC3339Nano timestamp

post.description: Atomically reset all capture buffers (logs, network, WebSocket, actions).
Mark test start/end for correlation. Entries added while a test boundary is active are tagged with the test ID.
Receives annotation data and screenshot from the extension when the user finishes a draw mode session.

screenshot_data_url.description: Base64 data URL of the screenshot

annotations.description: Annotation objects from the draw session

element_details.description: Map of correlation_id to element detail objects

get.description: Returns storage usage information for saved recordings.

delete.description: Delete a specific recording by ID.

post.description: Recalculate storage usage for all saved recordings.
Opens the recording file in the system file manager (Finder on macOS, Explorer on Windows).
Read a local file for upload automation (Stage 1, always available).
Inject a file path into a native file dialog (Stage 2, always available).
Submit an HTML form with file upload via multipart (Stage 3, always available).
Use OS automation (AppleScript/xdotool) to inject file path into native dialog. Requires --enable-os-upload-automation flag.
Sends Escape key to close a dangling native file dialog after a failed upload automation (Stage 4 cleanup). Requires --enable-os-upload-automation flag.

extensionClient.name: X-Gasoline-Client
extensionClient.description: Extension client identifier. Must match pattern 'gasoline-extension-*'. Required for extension-only endpoints.

dropped_count.description: Total log entries dropped due to buffer overflow

LogEntry.description: Console log entry. Arbitrary key-value pairs; level is required.

capture_logs.description: Whether console log capture is enabled

capture_actions.description: Whether user action capture is enabled

last_command_ack.description: ID of the last command acknowledged by the extension

command_results.description: Results from async commands the extension has executed

SyncCommandResult.description: Result of an async command execution returned by the extension via /sync.
